description: I don't know why, but it freezes all the time when I click somewhere or drag the window around. It doesn't affect playback, but it's mildly annoying

There are so few audiobook players out there for Linux users. This one is a welcomed addition to anyone who enjoys listening to books.

The interface is pretty straight forward and the "dark mode" setting is highly appreciated. For me, this is a "must-have" app.

Although audio books have become popular, readers are a bit hard to find.
Sure you can use normal audio players, but they suck at multi-chapter books, and you have a hard time resuming where you left off.

I loaded Cozy a month ago, and it worked great for my mp3 books. 
The interface is clean. 
It remembers where you ended off, and picks up with a 30 "recap"
It handles multi-chapter books perfectly.
With the latest update it also picked up the m4b's - which is why I rate it so high, since it is now managing my entire collection.

Does it tick all my boxes? 
No. You cannot edit covers or meta data inside the app, and I don't know why you would want to order books by the narrator (I suppose some do).
But even if the above functionalities are not priorities for the developer, the app works, and it works great.

I have definitely found a reason to stop looking for an alternative.
summary: Great app, Love It - It just works

description: There is a problem is the player. sometimes when I resume playing, it start from an other point and I should fix that manually every time.

Was looking for a player that can remember current position and finally I found a good one. Listened to 6 books and it was as easy as it can get, just hit play and if you missed something go back 30 sec.
M4B is not supported it is a bummer. Need to find some workaround, hence 4/5.
summary: Simple to use and works as expected

description:
Gets the job done very decent and smooth. Has the most important features like:

- play many audio formats
- well organized via tags
- coverart
- sleep timer
- multiple library locations

However I would love to have a player that also has some cloud like features, so I could switch between my pc, phone or laptop.
This app is so great it's actually turned me from a user to a code contributor! Working on making it even better and more performant as we speak.
Version 1.1.2 has a faulty sleep timer.
The app looks great and plays my audiobooks without too many problems. It does tend to be a bit unstable though. The UI also stutters and lags at times.
summary: Has potential. A little too buggy in it's current iteration
